```ts
class Grid
```

</div>

## constructor
```ts
new Grid(containerElement, options)
```

<div>

</div>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|containerElement|HTMLElement \| string|||<p>A base element for a module </p>|
|options|Partial&lt;Options&gt;|✔️|{}|<p>The option object of the Grid module </p>|

## Properties

### gap {#gap}

<div>

</div>

<p>Gap used to create space around items.</p>

**Type**: $ts:Grid.GridOptions["gap"]

**Default**: 0

```js
import { MasonryGrid } from "@egjs/grid";

const grid = new MasonryGrid(container, {
  gap: 0,
});

grid.gap = 5;
```

### defaultDirection {#defaultDirection}

<div>

</div>

<p>The default direction value when direction is not set in the render option.</p>

**Type**: $ts:Grid.GridOptions["defaultDirection"]

**Default**: "end"

```js
import { MasonryGrid } from "@egjs/grid";

const grid = new MasonryGrid(container, {
  defaultDirection: "end",
});

grid.defaultDirection = "start";
```

### useFit {#useFit}

<div>

</div>

<p>Whether to move the outline to 0 when the top is empty when rendering. However, if it overflows above the top, the outline is forced to 0. (default: true)</p>

**Type**: $ts:Grid.GridOptions["useFit"]

**Default**: true

```js
import { MasonryGrid } from "@egjs/grid";

const grid = new MasonryGrid(container, {
  useFit: true,
});

grid.useFit = false;
```

### preserveUIOnDestroy {#preserveUIOnDestroy}

<div>

</div>

<p>Whether to preserve the UI of the existing container or item when destroying.</p>

**Type**: $ts:Grid.GridOptions["preserveUIOnDestroy"]

**Default**: false

```js
import { MasonryGrid } from "@egjs/grid";

const grid = new MasonryGrid(container, {
  preserveUIOnDestroy: false,
});

grid.preserveUIOnDestroy = true;
```

### outlineLength {#outlineLength}

<div>

</div>

<p>The number of outlines. If the number of outlines is 0, it is calculated according to the type of grid.</p>

**Type**: $ts:Grid.GridOptions["outlineLength"]

**Default**: 0

```js
import { MasonryGrid } from "@egjs/grid";

const grid = new MasonryGrid(container, {
  outlineLength: 0,
  outlineSize: 0,
});

grid.outlineLength = 3;
```

### outlineSize {#outlineSize}

<div>

</div>

<p>The size of the outline. If the outline size is 0, it is calculated according to the grid type.</p>

**Type**: $ts:Grid.GridOptions["outlineSize"]

**Default**: 0

```js
import { MasonryGrid } from "@egjs/grid";

const grid = new MasonryGrid(container, {
  outlineLength: 0,
  outlineSize: 0,
});

grid.outlineSize = 300;
```

## Methods

### applyGrid {#applyGrid}

<div>

</div>

<p>Apply the CSS rect of items to fit the Grid and calculate the outline.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|direcion|"start" \| "end"|||<p>The direction to apply the Grid. (&quot;end&quot;: start to end, &quot;start&quot;: end to start) </p>|
|outline|Array&lt;number&gt;|||<p>The start outline to apply the Grid. </p>|

### getContainerElement {#getContainerElement}

<div>

</div>

<p>Return Container Element.</p>

**Returns**: HTMLElement

### getItems {#getItems}

<div>

</div>

<p>Return items.</p>

**Returns**: GridItem[]

### getChildren {#getChildren}

<div>

</div>

<p>Returns the children of the container element.</p>

**Returns**: HTMLElement[]

### setItems {#setItems}

<div>

</div>

<p>Set items.</p>

**Returns**: this

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|items|GridItem[]|||<p>The items to set. </p>|

### getContainerInlineSize {#getContainerInlineSize}

<div>

</div>

<p>Gets the container's inline size. (&quot;width&quot; if horizontal is false, otherwise &quot;height&quot;)</p>

**Returns**: number

### getOutlines {#getOutlines}

<div>

</div>

<p>Returns the outlines of the start and end of the Grid.</p>

**Returns**: GridOutlines

### setOutlines {#setOutlines}

<div>

</div>

<p>Set outlines.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|outlines|GridOutlines|||<p>The outlines to set. </p>|

### syncElements {#syncElements}

<div>

</div>

<p>When elements change, it synchronizes and renders items.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|options|RenderOptions|✔️|{}|<p>Options for rendering. </p>|

### updateItems {#updateItems}

<div>

</div>

<p>Update the size of the items and render them.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|items|GridItem[]|✔️|this.items|<p>Items to be updated. </p>|
|options|RenderOptions|✔️|{}|<p>Options for rendering. </p>|

### renderItems {#renderItems}

<div>

</div>

<p>Rearrange items to fit the grid and render them. When rearrange is complete, the <code>renderComplete</code> event is fired.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|options|RenderOptions|✔️|{}|<p>Options for rendering. </p>|

```js
import { MasonryGrid } from "@egjs/grid";
const grid = new MasonryGrid();

grid.on("renderComplete", e => {
  console.log(e);
});
grid.renderItems();
```

### getStatus {#getStatus}

<div>

</div>

<p>Returns current status such as item's position, size. The returned status can be restored with the setStatus() method.</p>

**Returns**: GridStatus

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|minimize|boolean|✔️||<p>Whether to minimize the status of the item. (default: false) </p>|

### setStatus {#setStatus}

<div>

</div>

<p>Set status of the Grid module with the status returned through a call to the getStatus() method.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|status|GridStatus||||

### getComputedOutlineSize {#getComputedOutlineSize}

<div>

</div>

<p>Get the inline size corresponding to outline.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|items|GridItem[]|✔️|this.items|<p>Items to get outline size. </p>|

### getComputedOutlineLength {#getComputedOutlineLength}

<div>

</div>

<p>Get the length corresponding to outline.</p>

**Returns**: number

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|items|GridItem[]|✔️|this.items|<p>Items to get outline length. </p>|

### destroy {#destroy}

<div>

</div>

<p>Releases the instnace and events and returns the CSS of the container and elements.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|Options|DestroyOptions|✔️|{}|<p>for destroy. </p>|

### trigger {#trigger}

<div>
  <span className="badge badge--danger">inherited</span>
</div>

<p>Trigger a custom event.</p>

**Returns**: this
- <p>An instance of the component itself</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|event|string \| ComponentEvent|||<p>The name of the custom event to be triggered or an instance of the ComponentEvent</p>|
|params|Array&lt;any&gt; \| $ts:...|||<p>Event data to be sent when triggering a custom event </p>|

```ts
import Component, { ComponentEvent } from "@egjs/component";

class Some extends Component<{
  beforeHi: ComponentEvent<{ foo: number; bar: string }>;
  hi: { foo: { a: number; b: boolean } };
  someEvent: (foo: number, bar: string) => void;
  someOtherEvent: void; // When there's no event argument
}> {
  some(){
    if(this.trigger("beforeHi")){ // When event call to stop return false.
      this.trigger("hi");// fire hi event.
    }
  }
}

const some = new Some();
some.on("beforeHi", e => {
  if(condition){
    e.stop(); // When event call to stop, `hi` event not call.
  }
  // `currentTarget` is component instance.
  console.log(some === e.currentTarget); // true

  typeof e.foo; // number
  typeof e.bar; // string
});
some.on("hi", e => {
  typeof e.foo.b; // boolean
});
// If you want to more know event design. You can see article.
// https://github.com/naver/egjs-component/wiki/How-to-make-Component-event-design%3F
```

### once {#once}

<div>
  <span className="badge badge--danger">inherited</span>
</div>

<p>Executed event just one time.</p>

**Returns**: this
- <p>An instance of the component itself</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|eventName|string \| $ts:...|||<p>The name of the event to be attached or an event name - event handler mapped object.</p>|
|handlerToAttach|function \| $ts:...|✔️||<p>The handler function of the event to be attached </p>|

```ts
import Component, { ComponentEvent } from "@egjs/component";

class Some extends Component<{
  hi: ComponentEvent;
}> {
  hi() {
    alert("hi");
  }
  thing() {
    this.once("hi", this.hi);
  }
}

var some = new Some();
some.thing();
some.trigger(new ComponentEvent("hi"));
// fire alert("hi");
some.trigger(new ComponentEvent("hi"));
// Nothing happens
```

### hasOn {#hasOn}

<div>
  <span className="badge badge--danger">inherited</span>
</div>

<p>Checks whether an event has been attached to a component.</p>

**Returns**: boolean
- <p>Indicates whether the event is attached. </p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|eventName|string|||<p>The name of the event to be attached </p>|

```ts
import Component from "@egjs/component";

class Some extends Component<{
  hi: void;
}> {
  some() {
    this.hasOn("hi");// check hi event.
  }
}
```

### on {#on}

<div>
  <span className="badge badge--danger">inherited</span>
</div>

<p>Attaches an event to a component.</p>

**Returns**: this
- <p>An instance of a component itself</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|eventName|string \| $ts:...|||<p>The name of the event to be attached or an event name - event handler mapped object.</p>|
|handlerToAttach|function \| $ts:...|✔️||<p>The handler function of the event to be attached </p>|

```ts
import Component, { ComponentEvent } from "@egjs/component";

class Some extends Component<{
  hi: void;
}> {
  hi() {
    console.log("hi");
  }
  some() {
    this.on("hi",this.hi); //attach event
  }
}
```

### off {#off}

<div>
  <span className="badge badge--danger">inherited</span>
</div>

<p>Detaches an event from the component.<br/>If the <code>eventName</code> is not given this will detach all event handlers attached.<br/>If the <code>handlerToDetach</code> is not given, this will detach all event handlers for <code>eventName</code>.</p>

**Returns**: this
- <p>An instance of a component itself </p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|eventName|string \| $ts:...|✔️||<p>The name of the event to be detached </p>|
|handlerToDetach|function \| $ts:...|✔️||<p>The handler function of the event to be detached </p>|

```ts
import Component, { ComponentEvent } from "@egjs/component";

class Some extends Component<{
  hi: void;
}> {
  hi() {
    console.log("hi");
  }
  some() {
    this.off("hi",this.hi); //detach event
  }
}
```

## Events
### contentError {#event-contentError}

<div>

</div>

<p>This event is fired when an error occurs in the content.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|e|[Grid.OnContentError](Grid:OnContentError)|||<p>The object of data to be sent to an event </p>|

```js
grid.on("contentError", e => {
  e.update();
});
```

### renderComplete {#event-renderComplete}

<div>

</div>

<p>This event is fired when the Grid has completed rendering.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|e|[Grid.OnRenderComplete](Grid:OnRenderComplete)|||<p>The object of data to be sent to an event </p>|

```js
grid.on("renderComplete", e => {
  console.log(e.mounted, e.updated, e.useResize);
});
```
